purpleculture_pinyin:
xiāng
country or countryside; native place; home village or town; township (PRC administrative unit)
деревня или сельская местность; Родина; родная деревня или город; поселок (административная единица КНР)

heisig_chinese_memo: A young man from the countryside is typically less hygienic than his city counterpart and rarely flosses his teeth.

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The long stroke on the end of this cocoon represents how wildlife is always bigger in the countryside.  Look at this massive cocoon.
humanum_full_description_en:
" Xiang " oracle bones from " 𠨍 " (two people kneeling and sitting opposite each other) from 皀, or from two " owing " (two people open their mouths), or from two 丮 (two people stretch out their hands for sacrifice), "皀" It is a food container for holding rice beams, and the characters are like two people sitting on knees facing each other and eating together. The original meaning is opposite were eating, extension for a feast, Meals worship, is " satisfy the beginning of the text" in; opposite meaning because there is also " the beginning of the text" of. Reference " Xiang ", " to ."

It means that the " township " oracle-bone inscriptions of the feast are not from Xuan, but from You (Jiu Zun), Ding, etc., the items served are different but the meaning of feasting is one (see Jin Xiangheng). This word is consistent with "Shu Wen" and "Book of Songs", "Poetry. "July" "Peng Jiu Si Sa" Mao Chuan: "Drink, the villagers also drink", but from the "皀" is often used instead of the word Congyou , from Er Jie from You or Province to [酉 Jie ].

Inscriptions from saponified, seen from the "From 𠨍 owed " in the late ' saponified Tim "Up" Ji "and" From food ", and" Ji "positive supplements" owe "word of mouth eating justice.

There are two usages of the Jiajin inscriptions: one, feasts and ceremonies, such as inscriptions "Ding Xin Xiang" and "Da Yi Zu Ding Zhong Xiang". Bronze inscriptions such as "Use the hometown guest" (Zeng Bowei pot), "Use the filial piety to the emperor and test the homeland" (Zhong Tuo's father 簋), "Use the hometown God to worship the ancestor" (Zhongshan king pot), and also pass " Enjoy " , See " Enjoy ." Second, the direction, the classics are " xiang ", " xiang " or " xiang ", such as the inscription "Qi Dong Xiang, Qi Bei Xiang"; inscriptions "Li Zhong Ting, Bei Xiang" (Shan Fu Shan Ding). The inscriptions also have the meaning of opposing the enemy, such as "their origin, Wang Zixiang (xiang)". In addition, the inscriptions are also commonly used as the " Qing " and the name of the public, referring to " Qing ".

" 𠨍 ", " village ", " Xiang ", " State " in this ancient homologous A Bronze gang, all for justice in the " 𠨍 " from opposite relative extension of the original meaning opposite to differentiate food, feast, Qing Shi , Xiangyi and other meanings.

"鄕" Xiaozhuan wrote " 𨞰 ", "Said Wen": "𨞰, the country is separated from the town, and the people are also sealed by the people. The husband is not governed. The six townships within the seal, the six townships are governed. From the sound of 𨛜皀." Man II " owes " Xiaozhuan falsely written two " town ", as " 𨛜 ", " village ", " Xiang " and with the sounds fake, so it is the village of training (Lee Hyo parameter set). One said that "hometown" is called " hometown ", which actually takes the meaning of sharing food, referring to clan settlements that eat together (see Yang Kuan).
humanum_short_description_en: " township " oracle bones from the word " 𠨍 " (two relatively kneeling) from saponified, or from two " owe " (two opposite mouth), or from the two-Ji (both reached for the dedication prayer festival), " saponified " It is a food container for holding rice beams, and the characters are like two people sitting on knees facing each other and eating together. The original meaning is to eat with each other, and the extension is feast and sacrifice. It is the first article of " feast ". Extended to hometown, township.
humanum_full_description:
「鄉」字甲骨從「𠨍」(兩人相對跪坐)從皀，或從二「欠」(兩人張口相向)，或從二丮(兩人伸手奉獻祭禱)，「皀」是盛稻粱的食器，字象兩人相向跪坐，共食一簋。本義為相向共食，引伸為饗宴、饗祀，是「饗」的初文；因有相向之意，亦是「嚮」的初文。參「饗」、「嚮」。

　　表示饗宴之「鄉」甲骨文有不從皀，而從酉(酒尊)、鼎等，侍奉的物品有異而饗獻之義則一(參金祥恒)。此字，與《說文》、《詩經》所載相合，《詩．七月》「朋酒斯饗」毛傳：「饗，鄉人飲酒也」，不過從「皀」之饗常用而代替了從酉的饗字而已，從二卩從酉或省作[酉卩]。

　　金文從𠨍從皀，未見從「欠」，後期於「皀」上添「亼」而從「食」，而「亼」正補充「欠」字張口進食之義。

　　甲金文用法有二：一，饗宴、饗祀，如卜辭「妣辛鄉」、「大乙祖丁眾鄉」。金文如「用鄉賓客」(曾伯陭壺)、「用敢鄉孝于皇且考」(仲榱父簋)、「以鄉上帝，以祀先王」(中山王壺)，又通「享」，參「享」。二，朝向，典籍作「鄉」、「嚮」或「向」，如卜辭「其東鄉，其北鄉」；金文「立中廷，北鄉」(善夫山鼎)。卜辭亦有對敵之意，如「其來，王自鄉(嚮)」。此外，金文還通用作公卿之「卿」及人名，參「卿」。

　　「𠨍」、「鄉」、「饗」、「卿」古本同源，甲金文通同，皆取義於「𠨍」，自相向、相對之本義引伸分化出相向就食、饗宴、卿士、鄉邑等義。

　　「鄕」小篆作「𨞰」，《說文》：「𨞰 ，國離邑，民所封鄉也。嗇夫別治。封圻之内六鄉，六鄉治之。从𨛜皀聲。」甲文二「欠」小篆訛寫成二「邑」，作「𨛜」，「鄉」、「饗」又音近相假，故有鄉里之訓(參李孝定)。一說「鄉邑」稱「鄉」，實取義於共食，指共同飲食的氏族聚落(參楊寬)。
humanum_short_description: 「鄉」字甲骨從「𠨍」(兩人相對跪坐)從皀，或從二「欠」(兩人張口相向)，或從二丮(兩人伸手奉獻祭禱)，「皀」是盛稻粱的食器，字象兩人相向跪坐，共食一簋。本義為相向共食，引伸為饗宴、饗祀，是「饗」的初文。引申為家鄉、鄉里。

Ideographic: Two people 乡 and ⻏ hunched over a meal 良
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 乡 [ xiāng ] country, village; rural
    • 郎 [ láng ] gentleman, young man; husband
①泛指小市鎮：鄉村。窮鄉僻壤。
②自己生長的地方或祖籍：家鄉。故鄉。鄉井。鄉里(a。家庭久居的地方；b。同鄉的人)。鄉黨(鄉里)。鄉試。
③中國行政區劃基層單位，屬縣或縣以下的行政區領導。
